question:
In context with the recent observation of the International Migrants Day, consider the following statements about the International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families:
  1. More countries of origin of migrants are signatory to the convention than the migrant receiving countries.
  2. India is a signatory to the convention.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: It is a multilateral treaty which entered into force in 2003. It was signed on 18th December 1990 and hence the date is observed as International Migrants Day. It is noted that none of the migrant receiving states in North America and Western Europe has ratified the convention. Most of its signatories are countries of origin of the migrants. Â Statement 2 is incorrect: India is not a signatory to this treaty. While India is the largest source of international migrants, it is also an important migrant receiving state. USA houses the maximum number of international migrants followed by Saudi Arabia and Germany.
